00070 // Define a new application type, each program should derive a class from wxApp
00071 class MyApp : public wxApp
00072 {
00073 public:
00074     // override base class virtuals
00075     // ----------------------------
00076 
00077     // this one is called on application startup and is a good place for the app
00078     // initialization (doing it here and not in the ctor allows to have an error
00079     // return: if OnInit() returns false, the application terminates)
00080     virtual bool OnInit();
00081 };
00082 
00083 // Define a new frame type: this is going to be our main frame
00084 class MyFrame : public wxFrame
00085 {
00086 public:
00087     // ctor(s)
00088     MyFrame(const wxString& title);
00089 
00090     // event handlers (these functions should _not_ be virtual)
00091     void OnQuit(wxCommandEvent& event);
00092     void OnAbout(wxCommandEvent& event);
00093         void OnPaint (wxPaintEvent & event);
00094         void OnSizeChange (wxSizeEvent & WXUNUSED(event));
00095         void OnMoveMouse (wxMouseEvent & event);
00096         void OnLeftDownMouse (wxMouseEvent & event);
00097 
00098         // rubber menu 
00099         void OnRubberMenuSize(wxCommandEvent & event);
00100         void OnRubberMenuStyle (wxCommandEvent & event);
00101 
00102 private:
00103         // Draw all the rectangles
00104         void DrawAllRectangles(const wxSize & size, wxDC & dc);
00106         wxRubberBand m_RubberBand;
00108         wxPoint m_rubberbandorigin;
00110         wxPen m_rubberbandPen;
00111         
00112     // any class wishing to process wxWidgets events must use this macro
00113     DECLARE_EVENT_TABLE()
00114 };

00116 // ----------------------------------------------------------------------------
00117 // constants
00118 // ----------------------------------------------------------------------------
00119 
00120 // IDs for the controls and the menu commands
00121 enum
00122 {
00123     // menu items
00124     Minimal_Quit = wxID_EXIT,
00125 
00126     // it is important for the id corresponding to the "About" command to have
00127     // this standard value as otherwise it won't be handled properly under Mac
00128     // (where it is special and put into the "Apple" menu)
00129     Minimal_About = wxID_ABOUT,
00130     // Rubber band menu items
00131     RubberBandPenSolid = wxID_HIGHEST+1,
00132     RubberBandPenDotted = wxID_HIGHEST+2, 
00133     RubberBandSizeSmall = wxID_HIGHEST+3,
00134     RubberBandsizeBig   = wxID_HIGHEST+4
00135 };
00136 
00137 // ----------------------------------------------------------------------------
00138 // event tables and other macros for wxWidgets
00139 // ----------------------------------------------------------------------------
00140 
00141 // the event tables connect the wxWidgets events with the functions (event
00142 // handlers) which process them. It can be also done at run-time, but for the
00143 // simple menu events like this the static method is much simpler.
00144 BEGIN_EVENT_TABLE(MyFrame, wxFrame)
00145     EVT_MENU(Minimal_Quit,  MyFrame::OnQuit)
00146     EVT_MENU(Minimal_About, MyFrame::OnAbout)
00147     EVT_PAINT (MyFrame::OnPaint)
00148     EVT_SIZE (MyFrame::OnSizeChange)
00149     EVT_MOTION (MyFrame::OnMoveMouse)
00150     EVT_LEFT_DOWN (MyFrame::OnLeftDownMouse)
00151     EVT_MENU (RubberBandPenDotted,MyFrame::OnRubberMenuStyle)
00152     EVT_MENU (RubberBandPenSolid,MyFrame::OnRubberMenuStyle)
00153     EVT_MENU (RubberBandSizeSmall,MyFrame::OnRubberMenuSize)
00154     EVT_MENU (RubberBandsizeBig,MyFrame::OnRubberMenuSize) 
00155 END_EVENT_TABLE()
00156 
00157 // Create a new application object: this macro will allow wxWidgets to create
00158 // the application object during program execution (it's better than using a
00159 // static object for many reasons) and also implements the accessor function
00160 // wxGetApp() which will return the reference of the right type (i.e. MyApp and
00161 // not wxApp)
00162 IMPLEMENT_APP(MyApp)
00163 
00164 // ============================================================================
00165 // implementation
00166 // ============================================================================
00167 
00168 // ----------------------------------------------------------------------------
00169 // the application class
00170 // ----------------------------------------------------------------------------
00171 
00173 bool MyApp::OnInit()
00174 {
00175     // create the main application window
00176     MyFrame *frame = new MyFrame(_T("wxRubberBand wxWidgets App"));
00177 
00178     // and show it (the frames, unlike simple controls, are not shown when
00179     // created initially)
00180     frame->Show(true);
00181 
00182     // success: wxApp::OnRun() will be called which will enter the main message
00183     // loop and the application will run. If we returned false here, the
00184     // application would exit immediately.
00185     return true;
00186 }
00187 
00188 // ----------------------------------------------------------------------------
00189 // main frame
00190 // ----------------------------------------------------------------------------
00191 
00192 // frame constructor
00193 MyFrame::MyFrame(const wxString& title)
00194        : wxFrame(NULL, wxID_ANY, title)
00195 {
00196         
00197 
00198         // set the frame icon
00199     SetIcon(wxICON(sample));
00200 
00201 #if wxUSE_MENUS
00202     // create a menu bar
00203     wxMenu *fileMenu = new wxMenu;
00204 
00205     // the "About" item should be in the help menu
00206     wxMenu *helpMenu = new wxMenu;
00207     helpMenu->Append(Minimal_About, _T("&About...\tF1"), _T("Show about dialog"));
00208 
00209     fileMenu->Append(Minimal_Quit, _T("E&xit\tAlt-X"), _T("Quit this program"));
00210 
00211         // the wxRubberBand Menu
00212         wxMenu *RubberBandMenu = new wxMenu;
00213         RubberBandMenu->Append (RubberBandPenSolid, _T("&Solid Rubber Band"),
00214                                                         _T("Set a solid RubberBand"), wxITEM_CHECK);
00215         RubberBandMenu->Append (RubberBandPenDotted, _T("&Dotted Rubber Band"),
00216                                                         _T("Set a dotted RubberBand"), wxITEM_CHECK);
00217         RubberBandMenu->Check (RubberBandPenDotted, TRUE);
00218         RubberBandMenu->AppendSeparator();
00219         RubberBandMenu->Append (RubberBandSizeSmall, _T("S&mall Rubber Band"),
00220                                                         _T("Set a Small RubberBand"),wxITEM_CHECK);
00221         RubberBandMenu->Check (RubberBandSizeSmall,TRUE);
00222         RubberBandMenu->Append (RubberBandsizeBig, _T("&Big Rubber Band"),
00223                                                         _T("Set a big Rubber Band"),wxITEM_CHECK);
00224 
00225     // now append the freshly created menu to the menu bar...
00226     wxMenuBar *menuBar = new wxMenuBar();
00227     menuBar->Append(fileMenu, _T("&File"));
00228         menuBar->Append(RubberBandMenu,_T("&Rubber Band"));
00229         menuBar->Append(helpMenu, _T("&Help"));
00230 
00231     // ... and attach this menu bar to the frame
00232     SetMenuBar(menuBar);
00233 #endif // wxUSE_MENUS
00234 
00235 #if wxUSE_STATUSBAR
00236     // create a status bar just for fun (by default with 1 pane only)
00237     CreateStatusBar(2);
00238     SetStatusText(_T("Welcome to wxRubberBand Sample"));
00239 #endif // wxUSE_STATUSBAR
00240 
00241         // Create a Selection Box (Rubber Band)
00242         m_RubberBand = wxRubberBand(this);
00243 
00244 }

00247 // event handlers
00248 
00249 void MyFrame::OnQuit(wxCommandEvent& WXUNUSED(event))
00250 {
00251     // true is to force the frame to close
00252     Close(true);
00253 }
00254 
00255 void MyFrame::OnAbout(wxCommandEvent& WXUNUSED(event))
00256 {
00257     wxString msg;
00258     msg.Printf( _T("This is the About dialog of the wxRubberBand sample.\n")
00259                 _T("Welcome to %s"), wxVERSION_STRING);
00260 
00261     wxMessageBox(msg, _T("About wxRubberSample"), wxOK | wxICON_INFORMATION, this);
00262 }
00263 
00264 void MyFrame::OnPaint(wxPaintEvent & event)
00265 {
00266         wxPaintDC dc(this);
00267     PrepareDC(dc);
00268 
00269         int xSize = 0, ySize = 0;
00270         dc.GetSize (&xSize,&ySize);
00271 
00272         // Create a buffer DC
00273         wxBufferedDC temp_dc(&dc,wxSize(xSize,ySize));
00274 
00275         // Draw the background rectangles
00276         DrawAllRectangles(wxSize(xSize,ySize), temp_dc);
00277 
00278         
00279 }
00280 
00282 void MyFrame::DrawAllRectangles(const wxSize & size, wxDC & dc)
00283 {
00284         wxBrush  myBrushes[] = {*wxBLUE_BRUSH,
00285                                                         *wxGREEN_BRUSH,
00286                                                         *wxWHITE_BRUSH,
00287                                                         *wxBLACK_BRUSH,
00288                                                         *wxMEDIUM_GREY_BRUSH,
00289                                                         *wxLIGHT_GREY_BRUSH,
00290                                                         *wxCYAN_BRUSH,
00291                                                         *wxRED_BRUSH};
00292 
00293         int RectWidth = (int) size.x / 8;
00294         int RectHeight = (int) size.y / 2;
00295 
00296         for (int i=0;i<9;i++)
00297                 {
00298                 dc.SetBrush(wxBrush(myBrushes[i]));
00299                 dc.DrawRectangle (i*RectWidth,0,RectWidth,RectHeight);
00300                 dc.SetBrush(wxBrush(myBrushes[8-i]));
00301                 dc.DrawRectangle (i*RectWidth,RectHeight,RectWidth,RectHeight);
00302                 }
00303         
00304 }
00305 
00306 void MyFrame::OnSizeChange(wxSizeEvent & WXUNUSED(event))
00307 {
00308         Refresh();
00309 }
00310 
00311 void MyFrame::OnMoveMouse(wxMouseEvent & event)
00312 {
00313         wxPoint myActualPosition = event.GetPosition();
00314         if (event.LeftIsDown())
00315                 {
00316                 m_RubberBand.SetGeometry(       m_rubberbandorigin.x, m_rubberbandorigin.y,
00317                                                                         myActualPosition.x - m_rubberbandorigin.x,
00318                                                                         myActualPosition.y - m_rubberbandorigin.y);
00319                 }
00320 }
00321 
00322 void MyFrame::OnLeftDownMouse(wxMouseEvent & event)
00323 {
00324         m_rubberbandorigin= event.GetPosition();
00325 }
00326 
00327 void MyFrame::OnRubberMenuStyle(wxCommandEvent & event)
00328 {
00329         // check the good menu
00330         // be sure the menu is checked;
00331         GetMenuBar()->Check(RubberBandPenDotted,FALSE);
00332         GetMenuBar()->Check(RubberBandPenSolid,FALSE);
00333         GetMenuBar()->Check(event.GetId(),TRUE);
00334         
00335         // choose a pen
00336         switch (event.GetId())
00337         {
00338         case RubberBandPenDotted:
00339                 m_rubberbandPen.SetStyle(wxDOT);
00340                 break;
00341         case RubberBandPenSolid:
00342                 m_rubberbandPen.SetStyle(wxSOLID);
00343                 break;
00344 
00345         }
00346         // Set the pen
00347         m_RubberBand.SetPen (m_rubberbandPen);
00348         // Clear the old rubber 
00349         m_RubberBand.ClearOldRubberRect();
00350         Refresh();
00351 }
00352 
00353 void MyFrame::OnRubberMenuSize(wxCommandEvent & event)
00354 {
00355         // check the good menu
00356         // be sure the menu is checked;
00357         GetMenuBar()->Check(RubberBandSizeSmall,FALSE);
00358         GetMenuBar()->Check(RubberBandsizeBig,FALSE);
00359         GetMenuBar()->Check(event.GetId(),TRUE);
00360 
00361         // change the rubber menu according to the user choice
00362         switch (event.GetId())
00363         {
00364         case RubberBandSizeSmall:
00365                 m_rubberbandPen.SetWidth(1);
00366                 break;
00367         case RubberBandsizeBig:
00368                 m_rubberbandPen.SetWidth(3);
00369                 break;
00370         }
00371         // Set the pen
00372         m_RubberBand.SetPen (m_rubberbandPen);
00373         // Clear the old rubber 
00374         m_RubberBand.ClearOldRubberRect();
00375         Refresh();
00376 }
